newsitem.title: VENEZUELA: Caracas stks close ahead as local CANTV offer ends.
newsitem.headline: Caracas stks close ahead as local CANTV offer ends.

text.p: Caracas stocks closed ahead a hair in thin trade as the share offering of Venezuelan telephone company CANTV drew to a close, traders said.
The market's 19-share index rose 0.75 percent to close at 6,053.20 points, as 14.7 million shares traded worth 3.8 billion bolivars ($8.1 million).
Institutional Venezuelan investors had until late Tuesday afternoon to place orders for the 50 million CANTV shares earmarked for the local market. Trade is due to begin next week.
"The market is adjusting itself for CANTV ... its entry is imminent. Everyone is readying themselves," said one broker.

Among traded issues, 20 rose, 15 fell and six closed flat. Steel company Sivensa continued its two week rise, gaining 8.00 bolivars to close at 357.00 bolivars, while bellwether stock Electricidad de Caracas finished flat at 540.00 bolivars.
